basics.name: Laura Vonessen
basics.label: Software engineer
basics.image: TODO: add image and change URL
basics.summary: I'm a software engineer passionate about designing software to work well. At Google, it was through designing and implementing usability improvements to performance testing infrastructure used across Google. At the University of Washington, it was through researching how to make accessibility a consideration from the very first classes computer science students take.

work.name: Google
work.summary: Designed and implemented usability improvements to performance testing infrastructure used across Google

work.name: University of Washington
work.summary: Conducted a design exploration of faculty professional development at scale, where the topic of the professional development was introducing accessibility topics into computer science courses

work.name: University of Washington
work.summary: Maintained course infrastructure, led quiz sections, held office hours, and graded

volunteer.summary: The OTW is responsible for AO3, an online archive of over 11 million fanworks. It also has an extensive tagging system, from which I've learned a lot about databases.

publications.name: Teaching Accessibility: A Design Exploration of Faculty Professional Development at Scale
publications.summary: Saba Kawas, Laura Vonessen, and Amy J. Ko

publications.name: Understanding the Needs of Searchers with Dyslexia
publications.publisher: CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems (CHI '18)
publications.summary: Meredith Ringel Morris, Adam Fourney, Abdullah Ali, and Laura Vonessen

publications.name: Towards domain-specific semantic relatedness: a case study from geography
publications.summary: Shilad Sen, Isaac Johnson, Rebecca Harper, Huy Mai, Samuel Horlbeck Olsen, Benjamin Mathers, Laura Souza Vonessen, Matthew Wright, and Brent Hecht

projects.name: AO3 Podfic Posting Helper
projects.description: A browser extension which streamlines the workflow for posting a new podfic on Archive of Our Own by importing metadata, such as tags and rating, into the new work form.
